sources.title: Large language model - Wikipedia
sources.snippet: A large language model (LLM) is a language model trained with self-supervised machine learning on a vast amount of text, designed for natural language processing tasks, especially language generation. The largest and most capable LLMs are generative pre-trained transformers (GPTs) and provide the core capabilities of modern chatbots. LLMs can be fine-tuned "Fine-tuning (deep learning)") for specific tasks or guided by prompt engineering. These models acquire predictive power regarding syntax, [...] In the DEPS ("describe, explain, plan and select") method, an LLM is first connected to the visual world via image descriptions. It is then prompted to produce plans for complex tasks and behaviors based on its pretrained knowledge and the environmental feedback it receives. [...] They consist of billions to trillions of parameters and operate as general-purpose sequence models, generating, summarizing, translating, and reasoning over text. LLMs represent a significant new technology in their ability to generalize across tasks with minimal task-specific supervision, enabling capabilities like conversational agents, code generation, knowledge retrieval, and automated reasoning that previously required bespoke systems.

sources.title: AI for Natural Language Processing (NLP) in 2024: Latest Trends ...
sources.snippet:
The landscape of NLP in 2024 is marked by significant advancements, particularly in transformer-based models, conversational AI, multimodal learning, and few-shot learning. However, with these innovations come challenges, particularly in ethics, energy efficiency, and fairness. The future of NLP looks promising as it moves toward more inclusive, efficient, and human-like language understanding, providing new opportunities across various industries. By keeping an eye on these trends, [...] Natural Language Processing (NLP) has been one of the most transformative fields within artificial intelligence, enabling machines to understand, generate, and interpret human language. In 2024, advancements in NLP are continuing to evolve rapidly, powered by improvements in algorithms, architecture, datasets, and computational capacity. This article will explore the latest trends in NLP, focusing on key advancements such as transformer models (like BERT and GPT), improvements in conversational [...] Key models like BERT (Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers) and GPT (Generative Pre-trained Transformer), have set the stage for most of the state-of-the-art NLP applications we see today. In 2024, the field has seen several advancements:

### 2. Conversational AI: ChatGPT and Beyond

sources.title: What is an LLM (large language model)? - Cloudflare
sources.snippet: A large language model (LLM) is a type of artificial intelligence (AI) program that can recognize and generate text, among other tasks. LLMs are trained on huge sets of data ‚Äî hence the name "large." LLMs are built on machine learning: specifically, a type of neural network called a transformer model. [...] In simpler terms, an LLM is a computer program that has been fed enough examples to be able to recognize and interpret human language or other types of complex data. Many LLMs are trained on data that has been gathered from the Internet ‚Äî thousands or millions of gigabytes' worth of text. Some LLMs continue to crawl the web for more content after they are initially trained. But the quality of the samples impacts how well LLMs will learn natural language, so an LLM's programmers may use a more [...] LLMs can be trained to do a number of tasks. One of the most well-known uses is their application as generative AI: when given a prompt or asked a question, they can produce text in reply. The publicly available LLM ChatGPT, for instance, can generate essays, poems, and other textual forms in response to user inputs.

sources.title: Applications of large language models (LLMs) - Interlake Mecalux Inc.
sources.snippet: LLM stands for large language model, which is an AI system trained on vast amounts of text using machine learning techniques, specifically deep neural networks. The goal of LLM applications is to perform a wide range of tasks, from recognizing patterns and understanding language to producing coherent responses. [...] LLM applications are reshaping how humans interact with information, solve problems, and create value. From business and education to research and creativity, this form of artificial intelligence (AI) automates complex tasks, streamlines processes, and enhances user and organizational experiences. The adaptability of LLM applications across multiple contexts makes them strategic, versatile tools for all kinds of industries.
